***N.B.*** *This Policy will only pay for a claim made under either Section 21, 23, 26 or 44 for the same event but not for more than one of the Sections.*

#### Section 45. Loss of Frequent Flyer Miles
In the event Your Trip is cancelled or postponed due to the events covered under:
Section 19-Travel Cancellation or
Section 22-Travel Postponement or
Section 40- Travel Cancellation due to COVID-19 or
Section 41 - Travel Postponement due to COVID-19.

We will reimburse You for the unused, pre-paid, and non-refundable costs of the air ticket You purchased using Your frequent flyer miles, up to the Benefit Limit of the applicable section provided that You are unable to recover Your lost frequent flyer miles from any other source.

You must submit proof of Your frequent flyer miles redemption for Your scheduled Flight at the time of claim.

We will convert the frequent flyer miles into Singapore dollars at a rate to be determined by Us.
questions: How does the policy handle claims for loss of frequent flyer miles when a trip is cancelled or postponed due to covered events under Sections 19, 22, 40, or 41, and what documentation is required to support such a claim?

In the event of a trip cancellation or postponement covered under Sections 19, 22, 40, or 41, how does the policy determine the reimbursement amount for unused frequent flyer miles, and what conditions apply regarding recovery from other sources?

What are the implications of the policy’s note that claims under Sections 21, 23, 26, or 44 for the same event cannot be made simultaneously, particularly in relation to a loss of frequent flyer miles claim under Section 45?
How does the policy convert frequent flyer miles into Singapore dollars for reimbursement purposes, and what discretion does the insurer have in determining the conversion rate?
Under what circumstances will the policy deny reimbursement for frequent flyer miles if the insured is able to recover the lost miles from another source, and how must this be demonstrated?
How do the benefit limits of Sections 19, 22, 40, or 41 affect the maximum reimbursement available for loss of frequent flyer miles under Section 45?
What are the interactions between the general policy exclusions and the specific coverage for loss of frequent flyer miles under Section 45 when a trip is cancelled or postponed due to COVID-19?

If a trip is postponed due to COVID-19 and the insured has prepaid air tickets purchased with frequent flyer miles, what conditions must be met for the policy to reimburse the unused miles, and how does this relate to Sections 40 and 41?
How does the policy address the timing of claims for loss of frequent flyer miles in relation to the cancellation or postponement event, and what proof must be submitted at the time of claim?

In cases where a trip cancellation or postponement is covered under multiple sections, how does the policy’s restriction on claims for the same event under Sections 21, 23, 26, or 44 impact the ability to claim loss of frequent flyer miles under Section 45?
What documentation is required to prove frequent flyer miles redemption for a scheduled flight, and how might failure to provide this documentation affect claim eligibility under Section 45?

How does the policy define the scope of ‘unused, pre-paid, and non-refundable costs’ of air tickets purchased with frequent flyer miles, and what exclusions might limit reimbursement under Section 45?
If an insured recovers part of their lost frequent flyer miles from a third party, how does the policy determine the reimbursable amount under Section 45, and what proof is needed to support this?
How do the COVID-19 specific sections (40 and 41) interact with the loss of frequent flyer miles coverage in Section 45, especially regarding trip postponement and cancellation scenarios?
What are the policy’s provisions regarding multiple claims for the same event under different sections, and how does this affect the insured’s strategy for claiming loss of frequent flyer miles?
In what ways might the insurer’s discretion in converting frequent flyer miles to Singapore dollars impact the final claim payout, and what factors could influence the conversion rate used?
How does the policy ensure that claims for loss of frequent flyer miles are not duplicated across different sections, and what mechanisms are in place to enforce this?
What are the conditions under which the policy will not reimburse frequent flyer miles if the trip cancellation or postponement is due to events not covered under Sections 19, 22, 40, or 41?
How does the policy treat frequent flyer miles purchased with a combination of cash and miles in terms of reimbursement eligibility under Section 45?
What is the process and timeline for submitting a claim for loss of frequent flyer miles, and how does this relate to the timing of the trip cancellation or postponement event?
